note_content.Chief Complaint: Frequent headaches and episodes of dizziness.
note_content.History of Present Illness: The patient has been experiencing recurrent headaches over the past two months, often accompanied by dizziness. No noticeable patterns but seems to occur more often post physical activity.
note_content.Past Medical History: Tommy was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus at age 7. His diabetes has been generally well-controlled with insulin therapy.
note_content.Family History: His father has Type 2 Diabetes and maternal grandmother has hypothyroidism.
note_content.Social History: Tommy is in fifth grade; enjoys soccer and video games. Lives with parents and one older sibling.
note_content.Review of Systems: Overall, the patient reports fatigue and occasional blurred vision, but no other significant findings like weight loss, fever, or night sweats.
note_content.Current Medications: Insulin aspart 5 units with meals, and insulin detemir 15 units at bedtime.
note_content.Vital Signs: BP 110/70, HR 78, Temp 98.6 F, Height 140 cm, Weight 40 kg.
note_content.Physical Examination: General: alert and oriented x3, in no acute distress. HEENT: PERRLA, EOMI, no nystagmus. Neck: supple, no thyromegaly. Cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs. Respiratory: Clear to auscultation bilaterally. Neurological: Alert, cranial nerves II-XII are intact, normal gait. Skin: No rashes. Abdomen: Soft, non-tender.
note_content.Investigations: Blood glucose level at time of exam was 165 mg/dL.

Assessment and Plan.Problem 1: Frequent headaches and dizziness possibly related to post-exertional hypoglycemia.
Assessment and Plan.Plan:
- Review and adjust insulin regimen after evaluating glucose logs.
- Encourage regular hydration, especially before and after exercise.
- Schedule a follow-up in 2 weeks or sooner if symptoms persist or worsen.
- Consider referral to a neurologist if no improvement.
